intro: Hippolytia dolichophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf hippolytia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the summer months. It is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its compact size and ornamental value.
